snippet: An earthquake in central Oklahoma last weekend has raised fresh concern about the security of a vast crude-oil-storage complex that sits at the crossroads of the nation’s oil-pipeline network.
abstract: Magnitude 4.5 earthquake in central Oklahoma, with epicenter close to Cushing Hub, large crude oil storage complex, has raised concerns about security, as facility has been designated critical national infrastructure; of particular concern is increased rate and intensity of earthquakes in state, attributed to injection of waste water produced by oil and gas industry deep into rock; state lawmakers have so far proved reluctant to curb practice.
lead_paragraph: An earthquake in central Oklahoma last weekend has raised fresh concern about the security of a vast crude-oil-storage complex that sits at the crossroads of the nation’s oil-pipeline network.

headline.main: New Concern Over Quakes in Oklahoma Near a Hub of U.S. Oil
headline.print_headline: New Concern Over Quakes Near a Hub of U.S. Oil
